meanings.definition: The action of regaining possession of something, especially when a borrower defaults on payments.
meanings.sent1: After the borrower failed to pay, the bank had to do repossessions of the car.
meanings.sent2: The bank had to handle multiple repossessions of homes last month.
meanings.sent3: When the cat kept stealing the toy mouse, the owner had to do repossessions of it.
meanings.sent4: His repossessions of lost time were futile, for the past could not be reclaimed.
meanings.sent5: The repossessions of stolen goods by the police were swift and efficient.

meanings.definition: The process of taking back property or goods due to non-payment.
meanings.sent1: The company had to deal with repossessions of equipment from clients who didn't pay.
meanings.sent2: Repossessions of furniture from delinquent customers were common for the store.
meanings.sent3: The repossessions of overdue library books caused quite a stir among the students.
meanings.sent4: In the game of Monopoly, repossessions of properties can quickly change the course of the game.
meanings.sent5: The repossessions of stolen art pieces by the museum were celebrated by art lovers.
